properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.action: Monitor Conditions As They Are Changing
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Cape Otway, Glenaire, Hordern Vale.
  • There is a bushfire at Blanket Bay Road, Cape Otway that is under control. 
  • Firefighters have been able to slow the spread of fire for now, but the situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.
  • This Watch and Act replaces the Watch and Act issued at 11:57 AM. 
The situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.
What you should do: 
  • Monitor changes to the situation. Increased wind speed, change in wind direction, smoke or poor visibility can indicate the situation is changing. 
  • A Drop in Center has been opened at the Apollo Bay Community Hall located at 4 Pengilley Avenue, Apollo Bay.
  • Enact your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes. 
  • If you have time, check your neighbours to see if they are monitoring conditions. 
  • Protect yourself and your family.
Leave if the situation changes or you feel unsafe. 
Remember to:
  • Take your pets, medications, mobile phone and charger. 
  • Many people have died trying to leave at the last minute during fires. 
  • Travel to the home of family or friends that are away from the warning area.
Impacts in your area:
  • Bushfires can spread quickly and are extremely dangerous.
  • Check the VicTraffic website (www.traffic.transport.vic.gov.au) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
  • Lighthouse Road, Cape Otway and Blanket Bay Road, Cape Otway are closed
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 08/01/2025 06:40 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • For information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:

properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This message is being issued for Dumosa.

  • There is a building fire at Calder Hwy, Dumosa which is generating a lot of smoke. 
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby roads and communities for up to 48 hours. 
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

Unless the situation changes, this will be the last message issued for this fire.   

Health information: 
  • If you need medical advice for exposure to smoke, seek medical advice or call Nurse on Call on 1300 606 024. 
  • Anyone experiencing wheezing, chest tightness and difficulty breathing should call Triple Zero (000).     
Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter 
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 
Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Cape Paterson, Wonthaggi. 
  • There is a bushfire at Moores Road, Wonthaggi.
  • Smoke is travelling in a south easterly direction towards Cape Paterson and may be visible from nearby communities and roads.
  • Firefighters are currently responding to this fire.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 08/01/2025 03:50 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Munro, Stockdale.
  • There is a bushfire in the pine plantation at Munro-Stockdale Road that is not yet under control.
  • The bushfire is travelling from in a northerly direction towards Stockdale-Fernbank Road.
  • Firefighters are responding to the fire. 
  • You may see or smell smoke.  
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
  • Keep the roads clear so emergency services can respond.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Firefighters are responding to this fire.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 08/01/2025 03:40 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: areas of the Grampians National Park affected by fire
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for areas of the Grampians National Park affected by fire.

  • The Bushfire in the Grampians National Park is now contained.
  • This advice message replaces the Advice issued Monday 6 January.
  • Firefighters continue to work on the fire monitoring hotspots, treating hazardous trees and clearing tracks.

Halls Gap will be open to visitors at 10:00am Wednesday 8 January.

Parts of the Grampians (Gariwerd) National Park will be open to visitors commencing 9:00am Friday 10 January. Until this time, no access to the park is permitted. 

For details on access to the park, visit the Parks Victoria Website. 

Community Newsletter No 5: Grampians (Gariwerd) National Park & Surrounds
    There is currently no threat to communities, but you should continue to stay informed and monitor conditions.
      What you should do: 
      • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. Plan what you would do if the situation changes. 
      • Review your fire survival plan. 
      • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes. 
      • If you see impacted wildlife - call 1300 226 226 or download the Wildlife Emergency App. 
      Recovery and resilience
      If you have been or may be impacted by bushfire, it is understandable if you are feeling concerned and experiencing a mix of strong mental, emotional or physical reactions right now. For emergency relief information during major incidents, call the VicEmergency hotline on 1800 226 226 or visit www.emergency.vic.gov.au/relief. 
      Impacts in your area: 
      • You may see smoke and small flare-ups within the burnt area which will be dealt with as they arise. 
      • Drivers may encounter fire crews and heavy machinery on roads and tracks. Please take care and drive safely. 
      • Many roads within the fire affected area remain closed. Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.transport.vic.gov.au) or call 13 11 70. 
      • Smoke from bushfire can reduce air quality and may affect your health. For more information visit the Better Health website. 
      This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

      The next update is expected by 11:00am 10 January 2025 or as the situation changes.

      Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
      • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
      • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
      • VicEmergency app
      • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
      • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
      Accessibility:
      The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
      • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
      • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text: ADVICE - BUSHFIRE - Stay Informed Incident Location: Grampians National Park Issue Date: Tuesday 07 January 2025, 07:31 pm Next Update: Friday 10 January 2025, 11:00 am More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/35710/moreinfo This Advice message is being issued for areas of the Grampians National Park affected by fire. - The Bushfire in the Grampians National Park is now contained. - This advice message replaces the Advice issued Monday 6 January. - Firefighters continue to work on the fire monitoring hotspots, treating hazardous trees and clearing tracks. Halls Gap will be open to visitors at 10:00am Wednesday 8 January. Parts of the Grampians (Gariwerd) National Park will be open to visitors commencing 9:00am Friday 10 January. Until this time, no access to the park is permitted. For details on access to the park, visit the Parks Victoria Website. Community Newsletter No 5: Grampians (Gariwerd) National Park & Surrounds There is currently no threat to communities, but you should continue to stay informed and monitor conditions.

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Blanket Bay Campground, Cape Otway. 
  •  It is Not Safe to Return or leave the Blanket Bay Campground, Cape Otway. 
  • The bushfire at Blanket Bay Road is under control. 
  • This Watch and Act message replaces the Watch and Act message issued at 12:35 PM.
If you left Blanket Bay Campground, it is Not Safe to Return. Be aware of potential dangerous bushfire and tree hazards.
What you should do:

If you have not already left: 
  • Stay where you are and avoid dangerous bushfire and tree hazards.
  • Check you have enough food, drinking water and medications - if you do not, phone Triple Zero (000) for assistance.
If you have already left: 
  • Do not return to your home until a Safe to Return notification is issued.
  • A Drop in Center is open at Apollo Bay Communty Hall, 4 Pengilley Avenue, Apollo Bay.
  • Register at a relief centre so your friends, family and authorities can be informed that you are safe.
  • Stay informed by listening to emergency broadcasters and monitoring warnings.
Impacts in your area:
  • The following roads are closed: Lighthouse Road, Cape Otway and Blanket Bay Road, Cape Otway.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria. 

The next update is expected by 08/01/2025 06:50 pm or as the situation changes. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 
Accessibility: 
  • The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline. 
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
WATCH & ACT - BUSHFIRE - Not Safe to Return
Incident Location: Blanket Bay Road, Cape Otway
Issue Date: Wednesday 08 January 2025, 12:41 pm
Next Update: Wednesday 08 January 2025, 06:50 pm

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/35726/moreinfo

This Watch and Act message is being issued for Blanket Bay Campground, Cape Otway. 
-  It is Not Safe to Return or leave the Blanket Bay Campground, Cape Otway. 
- The bushfire at Blanket Bay Road is under control. 
- This Watch and Act message replaces the Watch and Act message issued at 12:35 PM.


If you left Blanket Bay Campground, it is Not Safe to Return. Be aware of potential dangerous bushfire and tree hazards. 

What you should do:

If you have not already left: 
- Stay where you are and avoid dangerous bushfire and tree hazards.
- Check you have enough food, drinking water and medications - if you do not, phone Triple Zero (000) for assistance.
If you have already left: 
- Do not return to your home until a Safe to Return notification is issued.
- A Drop in Center is open at Apollo Bay Communty Hall, 4 Pengilley Avenue, Apollo Bay.
- Register at a relief centre so your friends, family and authorities can be informed that you are safe.
- Stay informed by listening to emergency broadcasters and monitoring warnings.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.location: Apollo Bay, Glenaire, Hordern Vale, Marengo, Cape Horn, Cape Otway, Johanna
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Apollo Bay, Cape Otway, Glenaire, Hordern Vale, Johanna, Marengo, Cape Horn. 
  • There is a bushfire at Blanket Bay Road, Cape Otway that is under control.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
  • Firefighters are working to fully extinguish this fire. 
  • The following road is closed: Blanket Bay Road.
  • The Great Ocean Road remains open.  
  • Check the VicTraffic website (www.traffic.transport.vic.gov.au) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
  • Checks Parks Victoria Website for parks and campground closure information  (www.parks.vic.gov.au)
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
Community should stay informed as conditions may change. 
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 08/01/2025 04:40 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
